title.narrative: Multinational - ECCAS Institutional Capacity Building Support Project (PARCI-ECCAS)
Multinational - Projet d’appui au renforcement des capacités institutionnelles de la CEEAC (PARCI-CEEAC)

description.narrative: Le Projet d'appui au renforcement des capacités institutionnelles de la Communauté économique des États de l'Afrique centrale (CEEAC) s'inscrit dans le cadre du Document de stratégie d'intégration régionale (DSIR, 2011-2015) de la Banque pour l'Afrique centrale, dont les principaux piliers sont axés sur le renforcement des capacités de la Communauté économique des États de l'Afrique centrale (CEEAC). Il vise à améliorer les performances dans la préparation et la mise en œuvre des programmes d'infrastructures régionales en renforçant les capacités institutionnelles. Il contribue également à l'amélioration du commerce intra-régional en soutenant les initiatives de rationalisation des politiques sectorielles de la CEEAC et de la CEMAC. Le coût du projet est de 8,23 millions d'UC, financé conjointement par le FAD (7 millions d'UC) et la CEEAC (1,23 million d'UC). Il sera mis en œuvre sur une période de quatre ans, de 2013 à 2016.

The Economic Community of Central African States (ECCAS) Institutional Capacity Building Support Project (PARCI-CEEAC) falls within the framework of the Bank’s Regional Integration Strategy Paper (RISP, 2011-2015) for Central Africa, the main pillars of which is focused on capacity-building for the Central African Economic Community (ECCAS). It aims to enhance performance in the preparation and implementation of regional infrastructure programmes by building institutional capacity. It also contributes to the improvement of intra-regional trade by supporting the streamlining ECCAS and CEMAC sector policy initiatives. The project cost is UA 8.23 million, jointly financed by the ADF (UA 7 million) and ECCAS (UA 1.23 million). It will be implemented over a four-year period from 2013 to 2016.

L'objectif du projet est de promouvoir l'intégration régionale en Afrique centrale en renforçant la capacité institutionnelle, humaine et opérationnelle de la CEEAC à mettre en œuvre des programmes régionaux et l'harmonisation des politiques sectorielles.

The project objective is to promote regional integration in Central Africa by building ECCAS’ institutional, human and operational capacity to implement regional programmes and the harmonization of sector policies.

Les principaux bénéficiaires directs du projet sont le Secrétariat général de la CEEAC, la Commission de la CEMAC et le Secrétariat technique du Comité de rationalisation Afrique centrale-CER qui participeront aux études et aux autres activités prévues dans le cadre de la rationalisation et de l'harmonisation des politiques et des normes régionales.

The project’s main direct beneficiaries are the ECCAS General Secretariat of ECCAS, the CEMAC Commission and the Technical Secretariat of the Central Africa-REC Rationalization Committee that will participate in studies and in other activities planned under the rationalization and harmonization of regional policies and standards.

participating-org.narrative: Economic Community of Central African States (ECCAS) General Secretariat

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

title.narrative: Share of intra-community trade in the region's total trade
People trained / recruited - of which women

target.value: Decrease in States' CIC-related arrears by 30% between 2011 and 2015

actual.value: 40% of the CIC's outstanding balances were reimbursed by member states, exceeding the 30% target for this output

title.narrative: Better coordinated and more effective implementation of regional projects/programmes

target.value: Disbursement rate of regional projects/programmes coordinated by ECCAS GS >> 30%

actual.value: 50% of ECCAS projects have a disbursement rate >30%

title.narrative: Focal points and ANEs have been sensitised on integration themes

target.value: 200 people trained, 40% of whom are women

title.narrative: COPIL’s TS is operational and the capacity for steering the streamlining process of CEMAC/ECCAS has been built

target.value: COPIL TS organisational framework set up. 16 COPIL TS officials trained, including 4 women

actual.value: COPIL's TS organisational framework is in place 90%. 16 COPIL TS officials trained, including 4 women

target.value: A communication plan with the 10 Member States has been developed and validated

title.narrative: The General Secretariat's operational and financial management system has been strengthened

target.value: Medium-term strategic framework validated and RBM adopted

actual.value: Medium-term strategic framework validated (80%). RBM system adopted

title.narrative: The ECCAS statistics unit is operational and infrastructure and trade databases are available

target.value: 100%: Statistics strategy available. Databases on available infrastructure

actual.value: Strategy available, 80%.Databases of available regional infrastructure. Foreign trade databases available

title.narrative: The PIDA Action Plan infrastructure projects are at an advanced stage of preparation

target.value: The 12 PAP-PIDA projects are at an S2 stage of preparation (feasibility studies completed) with at least 4 projects at the S4 stage (implementation)

actual.value: The 12 PIDA-PAPprojects are at an S2 level of preparation (feasibility studies conducted) 40 %

title.narrative: The harmonisation of the CEMAC/ECCAS Technical Committee and the Common Customs Code

target.value: The CETwas harmonised. Common Customs Code adopted. Harmonised monitoring mechanism set up

actual.value: The CET has been harmonised 50%. Common Customs Code adopted 50%. A harmonised trade policy has been adopted

title.narrative: The ECCAS Secretariat's legal and institutional framework has been strengthened

actual.value: The ECCAS founding texts have been reviewed
